Edit:

I\'ve bought way too many games.

Annos 2070 is a splendidly beautiful game so far. In both graphics and gameplay

So this is making me think about getting steam, except their about page doesn\'t answer the one question I have; If I buy games on it now and download them, can I re download and play them on any computer I buy later?
Yep. I\'ve done it before, it\'s probably the best gaming store out there, no doubt.

So this is making me think about getting steam, except their about page doesn\'t answer the one question I have; If I buy games on it now and download them, can I re download and play them on any computer I buy later?

Yep.

Basically the games are just attached to your account. So as long as you don\'t do something to get your account banned, you could download them anywhere again.

There\'s a few other programs similar to Steam, but Steam does it the best imo. They have the biggest store too. Mainly because they got to the market first.

I\'m starting to see other games start to require you to make an account for their \'Steam\' equivalent, like EA Games. They blow.

Last thing I want is to have my games spread across multiple accounts as well.

Also, I just bought 'The Binding of Isaac' and the 'Penumbra' package.

Maybe I should just hand Steam my bank account >_>
